intro: Arenaria bolosii, commonly known as the Bolosii sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine hairs, adapted to thrive in rocky or sandy soils. Arenaria bolosii is often found in open, sunny habitats such as coastal dunes and limestone outcrops.
